title: 111_hr3464
content:
The Act may be cited as the "National Future Farmers of America Commemorative Coin Act of 2009". The National Future Farmers of America Organization positively impacts students by developing leadership skills, was founded in 1928, created a national agricultural education model, and prepares members for various careers. The National Future Farmers of America Organization, founded in 1928, has over 9 million former members who are industry executives, members of Congress, farmers, and productive citizens. In 2009, it had over 500,000 members in 7,400 chapters across the US. The organization was chartered by Congress in 1950 and continues to be an educational organization in public schools. The National Future Farmers of America Organization, founded in 1928, has millions of former members who are industry executives, members of Congress, farmers, and productive citizens. In October 2012, the organization will celebrate its 85th anniversary. SEC. 3. COIN SPECIFICATIONS. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue gold and silver coins in commemoration of the National Future Farmers of America Organization. The gold coins will weigh 8.359 grams and the silver coins will weigh 26.7 grams, both containing specific percentages of gold and silver alloys. These coins will be legal tender according to section 5103 of title 31, United States Code. The coins minted under this Act in commemoration of the National Future Farmers of America Organization will be legal tender as per section 5103 of title 31, United States Code. Additionally, these coins will be considered numismatic items under sections 5134 and 5136 of title 31, United States Code. The design of the coins minted under this Act will symbolize the 85-year history of the National Future Farmers of America Organization. Each coin will feature a value designation, inscriptions of "Liberty", "In God We Trust", "United States of America", and "E Pluribus Unum", as well as the year 2012. The design will be chosen by the Secretary in consultation with the National Future Farmers of America Organization and the Commission of Fine Arts, and reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities for a 1-year period starting on January 1, 2012. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. The coins minted under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value, surcharge, and cost of designing and minting. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted with a reasonable discount. SEC. 7. SURCHARGES.

Sales of coins minted under this Act will include a $25 surcharge for gold coins and a $10 surcharge for silver coins. The surcharges will be paid to the National Future Farmers of America Foundation in Indianapolis to support leadership and agricultural education programs. The Comptroller General of the United States is authorized to audit the organization's expenditures related to these funds.
